physical_examinations.vital_signs: Glucose: 28 mg/dl (1.55 mmol/liter) at emergency department visit, with normal range 68–110 mg/dl (3.7–6.1 mmol/liter)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient reported lightheadedness, chills, diaphoresis, palpitations, and shakiness. Physical examination was unremarkable: well-developed, well-nourished; abdomen soft, nontender, with no palpable masses or organomegaly.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient experienced similar symptoms of lesser severity for approximately 3 years prior to presentation, typically occurring from 1000–1300 h.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Fasting blood glucose: 120 mg/dl (6.66 mmol/liter), Insulin levels: 95.4 pmol/liter (normal range, 6–144 pmol/liter)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Complete resolution of preoperative symptoms. Postoperative hyperglycemia noted with serum glucose levels as high as 303 mg/dl (16.8 mmol/liter).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Preoperative symptoms resolved completely after tumor resection. A postoperative low-output pancreatic fistula closed one week after surgery.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Fasting blood glucose: 120 mg/dl (6.66 mmol/liter), Insulin: 95.4 pmol/liter
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No evidence of recurrent disease on routine follow-up.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No abnormalities noted since surgery; condition improved.
